title.value: Влияние антиастенического и актопротекторного комплекса 'Гексаминат' на состояние обмена углеводов, ЦТК, активности трансаминаз в печени
Influence antiasthenic and protective complex 'Geksaminat' on a condition of exchange of carbohydrates, tricarbonic acid cycle, transaminasis activity in a liver
Influence antiasthenic and protective complex 'Geksaminat' on a condition of exchange of carbohydrates, tricarbonic acid cycle, transaminasis activity in a liver

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Borodinskij, A.N., Grodno State Medical Univ. (Belarus)
Konovalenko, O.V., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)
Maksimovich, E.N., Grodno State Medical Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: The functional state of carbohydrate metabolism and cycle of tricarboxylic acids in a liver of rats is studied at different prescription modes of protective aminoacid complex 'Geksaminat'. It is revealed that 'Geksaminat' raises hexokinase (HK) and glucokinase (GLK) activity at reduced phosphofructokinase (PFK) activity. It is accompanied by decrease in the maintenance of glucose and glukose- 6-phosphate. Strengthening of tricarboxilic acid cycle metabolites specifies that the drug is capable to increase adenosine triphosphate (ATP) production by the raised of recycling Acetyl-KoA from various metabolic sources. The received results allow concluding, that 'Geksaminat' has several metabolic effects which should be typical to antiasthenic preparations. At the same time, there were revealed no the expressed metabolic deviations among the studied parameters at introduction of the preparation. Results of our experiments allow recommending the drug for clinical tests.
